definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: But he continued to read new books and periodicals , and continued to live in the same old- fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 他依旧继续阅读新思想的书报，继续过旧式的生活。

sentences.english: These are the publications to which he subscribed.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是他订的杂志书报。

sentences.english: Please fetch from the book shelf and return after reading.
sentences.chinese: 在书报架中领取，阅完请归还。

sentences.english: Hong Kong's newsstands are full of colorful magazines and tabloids .
sentences.chinese: 香港书报摊上充满了以声色娱乐为主的杂志。

sentences.english: You can get them at most of the newspaper kiosks in the street.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数马路上的书报亭里都能买到。

sentences.english: Her allure could also be clearly seen on the newsstand.
sentences.chinese: 她的魅力还“伸向”了书报摊。

sentences.english: Few Chinese magazines can be found on the newsstands in Malaysia.
sentences.chinese: 马来西亚街头的书报摊，华文杂志寥寥可数。

sentences.english: Jog over to your newsstand and take a peek.
sentences.chinese: 慢跑到附近的书报摊瞧一瞧吧。

sentences.english: the customer interface documents may be provided via a kiosk.
sentences.chinese: 用户界面的文档可能由书报亭提供。

sentences.english: It's cheaper to take out an annual subscription than to buy the periodical from a news agent.
sentences.chinese: 一次订一年的杂志比到书报商手上零买要便宜些。

sentences.english: On the floor were piles of old books, magazines and newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 地板上是一堆堆旧的书报杂志。

sentences.english: These are illustrative examples from books and newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 这些是引自书报的阐释性例证。

sentences.english: You can buy it at newsstand.
There will be not any supermarkets or newsstands along the newly-built channels.
sentences.chinese: 新建的通道两边不再设置超市和书报亭。

sentences.english: The cupboard is chocked up with his books and papers.
sentences.chinese: 那个小橱塞满了他的书报。

definition: books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
reference book (such as dictionary, almanac, gazetteer etc)
